posts.post_text:
Say hello to our 2025 summer intern class! It was great to chat with our impressive interns here at McDonald’s Global Headquarters in Chicago and answer their questions on working at McDonald’s and navigating their #career paths. 

Any advice for those completing an #internship this summer? Share it in the comments below. #NationalInternDay

posts.post_text:
It is with a heavy heart that I share that Michael (Mike) R. Quinlan, former CEO and Chairman of McDonald’s, has passed away.

Mike’s storied career with McDonald's began in 1963 as a summer mail clerk. In fact, he got his start at McDonald’s through a serendipitous connection, as he was the college roommate of one of June Martino’s sons. June, a legendary figure in McDonald’s history, was Ray Kroc’s first bookkeeper and played a pivotal role in shaping the franchise model.

In his more than 35 years with McDonald’s, he rose through the System, spending time in the restaurants and our headquarters to ultimately lead the business as President and COO in 1982, CEO in 1987, and Chairman of the Board in 1990.

Mike, affectionately known as “Q”, has a legacy that extends far beyond the boardroom. He was a passionate philanthropist and lifelong supporter of education. His generous contributions to Loyola University Chicago, where he studied and later served as Chairman of the Board, led to the creation of the Quinlan School of Business, Loyola University Chicago. He also championed community initiatives, including the construction of a Ronald McDonald House near Loyola’s Medical Center. Mike’s impact on our brand, our people, and our values will be felt for generations.

We extend our deepest condolences to Mike’s family, friends, and all who had the privilege of working with him. Let us honor his memory by continuing to lead with the same care, commitment, and courage that defined his remarkable journey.

posts.post_text:
With Father’s Day coming up, I thought I’d share how I manage to balance work and parenting. It can be tough but it’s always rewarding – and I’m grateful to have my wife as my partner through it all.  

#Parents of LinkedIn, let me know your #worklife tips in the comments. Happy Father’s Day to everyone celebrating this weekend! #advice

As long as McDonald's has been around, we’ve stayed true to a simple promise: delicious food at great value. That promise matters now more than ever – and we’re not taking our foot off the gas.

Thanks to CNBC’s Squawk Box for inviting me to share more about the return of our Extra Value Meals in the U.S., our global commitment to core menu items, and the bigger picture behind it all. What energizes me most is seeing how our Franchisees, suppliers, and employees are rallying together with purpose – making sure McDonald’s continues to deliver those everyday feel-good moments, at a price that feels just right.

posts.post_text: Fred Smith, founder of FedEx, was a visionary and business legend. More importantly, he was a dedicated family man and philanthropist who made the world a better place. He will be missed.

posts.post_text: It's back tomorrow... any guesses on which new U.S. #menu item I'm tasting? Stay tuned for the reveal.

Earlier this year, I asked you to share your earliest McDonald's memory, and you all delivered in the comments section. I'm sharing some of my favorites in celebration of McDonald's 70th anniversary. Keep the memories coming in the comments!
The #SnackWrap is back in the U.S., and it was worth the wait. Which Snack Wrap is your new favorite: Spicy or Ranch?

This morning, we released McDonald's Q2 2025 #earnings results. Our performance in the quarter reflects the power of compelling value, standout marketing, and menu innovation – proving again that when we stay focused on executing what matters most to our customers, we grow. Our technology investments and ability to scale digital solutions at speed will continue to elevate the @McDonald’s experience for customers, crew, and our global System. 

Learn more about our earnings results: https://lnkd.in/givK_DgK

Career paths often come with unexpected twists – and I’ve faced a few in my journey, but they’ve always paid off in some way or another. Let me know in the comments some of the unusual #career changes you’ve faced, and what they taught you. #careeradvice

My 10 years under the Golden Arches have flown by, and looking back, some of my favorite memories are rooted in the restaurants and the incredible people who make McDonald's a great place to work.  

To my McDonald’s colleagues, Franchisees and suppliers:  how long have you been with the company? Let me know in the comments so we can celebrate our time together. #anniversary

I look forward to checking a few things off my summer bucket list each year, and in 2025, I'm especially excited to do some traveling, both for work and for family time. Let me know in the comments what's on your summer bucket list.

Our industry is constantly evolving, and I’m especially impressed with how we’re embracing #digital innovation at McDonald's.

What are some of your favorite #QSR innovations?
Did you know that beyond serving as McDonald's CEO, I also hold the title of Chairman of the Board? Here’s a little breakdown on how these two roles differ, and how I balance them.

My #career path has brought me to some incredible places, guided by my family, friends, and inspiring #mentors. Joining LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky on his podcast, The Path, offered me a unique opportunity to reflect on where I’ve been and the lessons I’ve learned along the way. 

Thanks, Ryan, for the thoughtful conversation, and for inviting me to share my advice on carving out a path to be proud of. Watch the full interview here: https://bit.ly/44vAES9

One of my favorite gigs as CEO is recognizing McDonald's hard-working employees – whether it’s meeting crew in our restaurants around the world or celebrating our top-performing corporate employees with a Presidents’ Award. Our 2024 winners embody McDonald’s values and truly make our Golden Arches shine bright. Congratulations to this year’s recipients: https://bit.ly/43w4tBR 

Join me in congratulating our winners in the comments!

posts.post_text: I’m finally addressing a frequently asked question...did the answer surprise you? Let me know in the comments what your go-to McDonald’s meal is.

It’s normal to feel imposter syndrome throughout your #career. The important thing is to remember the hard work you’ve put in to get where you are, and that you’ve been placed in your role because you’re capable.  

Let me know if you have any other tips on navigating imposter syndrome in the comments below.

I’m excited to share that Emily Reasor will join McDonald's this month as Senior Vice President and Chief Strategy Officer. This hire signals our intent to make strategy a dynamic capability – one that drives execution, unlocks growth, and strengthens our competitive edge.
  
As we unlock the next chapter of our growth, Emily will work across our global business to identify new opportunities, embed strategic discipline into how we operate, and ensure our priorities remain anchored in what matters most to our customers, communities and the McDonald’s system.
  
Welcome to the McFamily, Emily - I look forward to all of the exciting work to come.

posts.post_text:
When you put people first, everything else follows. This is the belief that guided Ray Kroc when he opened the first franchised McDonald's restaurant in Des Plaines, Illinois, 70 years ago. It’s the belief that remains deeply embedded in our business, from our restaurant crew members to our franchisees to our suppliers to our corporate teams. 

Reflecting on my ten years under the Golden Arches, my favorite memories are rooted in our restaurants and the incredible people who make McDonald’s a great place to work. In celebration of our 70th anniversary and Founder’s Day, I want to shine a light on the folks who keep Ray’s spirit alive in our restaurants and beyond. Each day, you make McDonald’s proud.  

While we’ve evolved over the years, our shared commitment to our values and serving our customers and communities hasn't changed. I'm confident we will continue to make delicious feel-good moments for generations to come. #WeMakeMcDonalds
